summary: The document is a secret communication from March 1996, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details a postcard received by an ambassador, postmarked February 1996, from an individual in Minnesota. The postcard contains a stamped message accusing the CIA of assassinating President Kennedy on orders from the military-industrial complex, with David Rockefeller named as its chairman. The message directs the recipient to write to Rockefeller at Chase-Manhattan Bank in New York City. The postcard is unsigned but includes a printed address label from W. St. Paul, Minn.
key_findings: The document is part of the JFK assassination records, indicating its historical significance.
It contains an unsolicited accusation against the CIA and the military-industrial complex in the assassination of President Kennedy.
David Rockefeller is specifically named as the chairman of the alleged group behind the assassination.
The postcard's message is stamped, not handwritten, and the sender's identity is concealed except for a printed address label.
